Description:
Ballistics of the 3UBK2 100x910mmR round with the 3BK3 HEAT-FS projectile, fired from the T-12 and MT-12 anti-tank guns. These rounds entered service in 1961, and was equipped with the GPV-2 piezoelectric-spitback fuze.

Loads 4.9 kg of 13/1 DG-3 grains. Tabulated velocity is 975 m/s from 2,200 kgf/cm² breech pressure, converted from copper crusher gauge with a factor of 1.12 x 0.9805. Projectile travel estimated from a gun length of 6650 mm, chamber length 913 mm, and a measured length of 345 mm for the breech. Projectile set approximately 80 mm into cartridge case, 0.628 L deducated from chamber volume.

The ballistics of this entry is interchangeable among the following shots:
Round   Proj.  Design
3UBK2   3BK3   Steel liner
3UBK2M  3BK3M  Copper liner
